body:
Hm, I can't reproduce this on macOS. Memory usage is hovering steadily around 130â€“140mb.

Slightly modified gist including memory logging: https://gist.github.com/a2a70e7f6ff7cd46e0a09485d838ea44

@nornagon I used the fiddle you have. process.memoryUsage is not catching the leak as it seems to be happening in the renderer process.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11471458/102427279-050e1d00-3fdf-11eb-819c-6845bbba8910.png)

rename.from: webContents.send and ipcRenderer.on potential memory leak
rename.to: Memory leak when passing IPC events over contextBridge

body: (As a side note, btw, exposing `ipcRenderer.on` directly over the context bridge is a security issue and somewhat defeats the purpose of context isolation. I'd recommend not doing that in any production app.)

@nornagon What would you recommend a good alternative be for utilizing ipcRenderer on contextBridge? The only "direct" reference I have is for ipcRenderer.on (but it is still a function calling ipcRenderer.on, not a direct exposure of ipcRenderer.on). For all my "send"s, I use properties on contextBridge that call specific channels on ipcRenderer.send.
@Lovinity expose specific methods that your app needs, instead of allowing the app to listen to any IPC message.

issue.title: ipcRenderer returns without 'on' method over contextBridge

repository.name: electron

issue.title: fix: clean up base::LinkedList in context_bridge::ObjectCache

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
base::LinkedList does not delete its members on destruction. We need to manually ensure the linkedlist is empty when the ObjectCache is destroyed.

Fixes #27039

Notes: Fixed memory leak when sending non-primitives over the context bridge
